alert.note: Alert for La Paz; Yuma (Arizona) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Phoenix (Central Arizona and California Desert)
info.headline: Flood Advisory issued July 26 at 7:06PM MST until July 27 at 2:15AM MST by NWS Phoenix
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 1015 PM MST THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...Portions of southwest Arizona and west central Arizona, including the following counties, in southwest Arizona, Yuma. In west central Arizona, La Paz. * WHEN...Until 1015 PM MST. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. Water over roadways, particularly Highway 95. Some low-water crossings may become impassable. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 706 PM MST, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. Minor flooding may begin shortly in Tyson Wash. Up to 0.5 inches of rain have fallen. - Tyson Wash is the most likely place to experience minor flooding. This includes the following streams and drainages... Cholla Wash, La, Plomosa Wash, Tyson Wash, French Creek, Scaddan Wash and Smith Wash. Additional rainfall amounts up to 0.5 inches are expected over the area. This additional rain may result in minor flooding. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Quartzsite. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding.
